metadata.title: CVE-2019-3559 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Java Facebook Thrift servers would not error upon receiving messages withcontainers of fields of unknown type. As a result, malicious clients couldsend short messages which would take a long time for the server to parse,potentially leading to denial of service. This issue affects FacebookThrift prior to v2019.02.18.00.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3559` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libthrift-java - 0.13.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libthrift-java package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.13.0-1').
